trans-unit.source: Set up a geofence
trans-unit.target: Set up a geofence

trans-unit.source: Set up a Geofence in your app, and learn how to handle notifications in the foreground and background.
trans-unit.target: Set up a Geofence in your app, and learn how to handle notifications in the foreground and background.

trans-unit.source: Set up a geofence
trans-unit.target: Set up a geofence

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Set up a [**Geofence**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263587) in your app, and learn how to handle notifications in the foreground and background.
trans-unit.target: Set up a [**Geofence**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263587) in your app, and learn how to handle notifications in the foreground and background.

trans-unit.source: **Tip** To learn more about accessing location in your app, download the following sample from the [Windows-universal-samples repo](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619979) on GitHub.
trans-unit.target: **Tip** To learn more about accessing location in your app, download the following sample from the [Windows-universal-samples repo](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619979) on GitHub.

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) map sample
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) map sample

trans-unit.source: Enable the location capability
trans-unit.target: Enable the location capability

trans-unit.source: In **Solution Explorer**, double-click on **package.appxmanifest** and select the **Capabilities** tab.
trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer**, double-click on **package.appxmanifest** and select the **Capabilities** tab.

trans-unit.source: In the **Capabilities** list, check **Location**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Capabilities** list, check **Location**.

trans-unit.source: This adds the `Location` device capability to the package manifest file.
trans-unit.target: This adds the `Location` device capability to the package manifest file.

trans-unit.source: Set up a geofence
trans-unit.target: Set up a geofence

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Request access to the user's location
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Request access to the user's location

trans-unit.source: **Important** You must request access to the user's location by using the [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn859152) method before attempting to access the user's location.
trans-unit.target: **Important** You must request access to the user's location by using the [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn859152) method before attempting to access the user's location.

trans-unit.source: You must call the **RequestAccessAsync** method from the UI thread and your app must be in the foreground.
trans-unit.target: You must call the **RequestAccessAsync** method from the UI thread and your app must be in the foreground.

trans-unit.source: Your app will not be able to access the user's location information until after the user grants permission to your app.
trans-unit.target: Your app will not be able to access the user's location information until after the user grants permission to your app.

trans-unit.source: The [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn859152) method prompts the user for permission to access their location.
trans-unit.target: The [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn859152) method prompts the user for permission to access their location.

trans-unit.source: The user is only prompted once (per app).
trans-unit.target: The user is only prompted once (per app).

trans-unit.source: After the first time they grant or deny permission, this method no longer prompts the user for permission.
trans-unit.target: After the first time they grant or deny permission, this method no longer prompts the user for permission.

trans-unit.source: To help the user change location permissions after they've been prompted, we recommend that you provide a link to the location settings as demonstrated later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: To help the user change location permissions after they've been prompted, we recommend that you provide a link to the location settings as demonstrated later in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Register for changes in geofence state and location permissions
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Register for changes in geofence state and location permissions

trans-unit.source: In this example, a **switch** statement is used with **accessStatus** (from the previous example) to act only when access to the user's location is allowed.
trans-unit.target: In this example, a **switch** statement is used with **accessStatus** (from the previous example) to act only when access to the user's location is allowed.

trans-unit.source: If access to the user's location is allowed, the code accesses the current geofences, registers for geofence state changes, and registers for changes in location permissions.
trans-unit.target: If access to the user's location is allowed, the code accesses the current geofences, registers for geofence state changes, and registers for changes in location permissions.

trans-unit.source: **Tip** When using a geofence, monitor changes in location permissions using the [**StatusChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263646) event from the GeofenceMonitor class instead of the StatusChanged event from the Geolocator class.
trans-unit.target: **Tip** When using a geofence, monitor changes in location permissions using the [**StatusChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263646) event from the GeofenceMonitor class instead of the StatusChanged event from the Geolocator class.

trans-unit.source: A [**GeofenceMonitorStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263599) of **Disabled** is equivalent to a disabled [**PositionStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225599) - both indicate that the app does not have permission to access the user's location.
trans-unit.target: A [**GeofenceMonitorStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263599) of **Disabled** is equivalent to a disabled [**PositionStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225599) - both indicate that the app does not have permission to access the user's location.

trans-unit.source: Then, when navigating away from your foreground app, unregister the event listeners.
trans-unit.target: Then, when navigating away from your foreground app, unregister the event listeners.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Create the geofence
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Create the geofence

trans-unit.source: Now, you are ready to define and set up a [**Geofence**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263587) object.
trans-unit.target: Now, you are ready to define and set up a [**Geofence**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263587) object.

trans-unit.source: There are several different constructor overloads to choose from, depending on your needs.
trans-unit.target: There are several different constructor overloads to choose from, depending on your needs.

trans-unit.source: In the most basic geofence constructor, specify only the [**Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263724) and the [**Geoshape**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263718) as shown here.
trans-unit.target: In the most basic geofence constructor, specify only the [**Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263724) and the [**Geoshape**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263718) as shown here.

trans-unit.source: You can fine-tune your geofence further by using one of the other constructors.
trans-unit.target: You can fine-tune your geofence further by using one of the other constructors.

trans-unit.source: In the next example, the geofence constructor specifies these additional parameters:
trans-unit.target: In the next example, the geofence constructor specifies these additional parameters:

trans-unit.source: [**MonitoredStates**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263728) - Indicates what geofence events you want to receive notifications for entering the defined region, leaving the defined region, or removal of the geofence.
trans-unit.target: [**MonitoredStates**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263728) - Indicates what geofence events you want to receive notifications for entering the defined region, leaving the defined region, or removal of the geofence.

trans-unit.source: [**SingleUse**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263732) - Removes the geofence once all the states the geofence is being monitored for have been met.
trans-unit.target: [**SingleUse**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263732) - Removes the geofence once all the states the geofence is being monitored for have been met.

trans-unit.source: [**DwellTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263703) - Indicates how long the user must be in or out of the defined area before the enter/exit events are triggered.
trans-unit.target: [**DwellTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263703) - Indicates how long the user must be in or out of the defined area before the enter/exit events are triggered.

trans-unit.source: [**StartTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263735) - Indicates when to start monitoring the geofence.
trans-unit.target: [**StartTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263735) - Indicates when to start monitoring the geofence.

trans-unit.source: [**Duration**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263697) - Indicates the period for which to monitor the geofence.
trans-unit.target: [**Duration**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263697) - Indicates the period for which to monitor the geofence.

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Handle changes in location permissions
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Handle changes in location permissions

trans-unit.source: The [**GeofenceMonitor**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263595) object triggers the [**StatusChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263646) event to indicate that the user's location settings changed.
trans-unit.target: The [**GeofenceMonitor**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263595) object triggers the [**StatusChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263646) event to indicate that the user's location settings changed.

trans-unit.source: That event passes the corresponding status via the argument's **sender.Status** property (of type [**GeofenceMonitorStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263599)).
trans-unit.target: That event passes the corresponding status via the argument's **sender.Status** property (of type [**GeofenceMonitorStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263599)).

trans-unit.source: Note that this method is not called from the UI thread and the [**Dispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208211) object invokes the UI changes.
trans-unit.target: Note that this method is not called from the UI thread and the [**Dispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208211) object invokes the UI changes.

trans-unit.source: Set up foreground notifications
trans-unit.target: Set up foreground notifications

trans-unit.source: After your geofences are created, you must add the logic to handle what happens when a geofence event occurs.
trans-unit.target: After your geofences are created, you must add the logic to handle what happens when a geofence event occurs.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the [**MonitoredStates**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263728) that you have set up, you may receive an event when:
trans-unit.target: Depending on the [**MonitoredStates**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263728) that you have set up, you may receive an event when:

trans-unit.source: The user enters a region of interest.
trans-unit.target: The user enters a region of interest.

trans-unit.source: The user leaves a region of interest.
trans-unit.target: The user leaves a region of interest.

trans-unit.source: The geofence has expired or been removed.
trans-unit.target: The geofence has expired or been removed.

trans-unit.source: Note that a background app is not activated for a removal event.
trans-unit.target: Note that a background app is not activated for a removal event.

trans-unit.source: You can listen for events directly from your app when it is running or register for a background task so that you receive a background notification when an event occurs.
trans-unit.target: You can listen for events directly from your app when it is running or register for a background task so that you receive a background notification when an event occurs.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Register for geofence state change events
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Register for geofence state change events

trans-unit.source: For your app to receive a foreground notification of a geofence state change, you must register an event handler.
trans-unit.target: For your app to receive a foreground notification of a geofence state change, you must register an event handler.

trans-unit.source: This is typically set up when you create the geofence.
trans-unit.target: This is typically set up when you create the geofence.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Implement the geofence event handler
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Implement the geofence event handler

trans-unit.source: The next step is to implement the event handlers.
trans-unit.target: The next step is to implement the event handlers.

trans-unit.source: The action taken here depends on what your app is using the geofence for.
trans-unit.target: The action taken here depends on what your app is using the geofence for.

trans-unit.source: Set up background notifications
trans-unit.target: Set up background notifications

trans-unit.source: After your geofences are created, you must add the logic to handle what happens when a geofence event occurs.
trans-unit.target: After your geofences are created, you must add the logic to handle what happens when a geofence event occurs.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the [**MonitoredStates**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263728) that you have set up, you may receive an event when:
trans-unit.target: Depending on the [**MonitoredStates**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263728) that you have set up, you may receive an event when:

trans-unit.source: The user enters a region of interest.
trans-unit.target: The user enters a region of interest.

trans-unit.source: The user leaves a region of interest.
trans-unit.target: The user leaves a region of interest.

trans-unit.source: The geofence has expired or been removed.
trans-unit.target: The geofence has expired or been removed.

trans-unit.source: Note that a background app is not activated for a removal event.
trans-unit.target: Note that a background app is not activated for a removal event.

trans-unit.source: To listen for a geofence event in the background
trans-unit.target: To listen for a geofence event in the background

trans-unit.source: Declare the background task in your app’s manifest.
trans-unit.target: Declare the background task in your app’s manifest.

trans-unit.source: Register the background task in your app.
trans-unit.target: Register the background task in your app.

trans-unit.source: If your app needs internet access, say for accessing a cloud service, you can set a flag for that when the event is triggered.
trans-unit.target: If your app needs internet access, say for accessing a cloud service, you can set a flag for that when the event is triggered.

trans-unit.source: You can also set a flag to make sure that the user is present when the event is triggered so that you are sure that the user gets notified.
trans-unit.target: You can also set a flag to make sure that the user is present when the event is triggered so that you are sure that the user gets notified.

trans-unit.source: While your app is running in the foreground, prompt the user to grant your app location permissions.
trans-unit.target: While your app is running in the foreground, prompt the user to grant your app location permissions.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Register for geofence state change events
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Register for geofence state change events

trans-unit.source: In your app's manifest, under the **Declarations** tab, add a declaration for a location background task.
trans-unit.target: In your app's manifest, under the **Declarations** tab, add a declaration for a location background task.

trans-unit.source: To do this:
trans-unit.target: To do this:

trans-unit.source: Add a declaration of type **Background Tasks**.
trans-unit.target: Add a declaration of type **Background Tasks**.

trans-unit.source: Set a property task type of **Location**.
trans-unit.target: Set a property task type of **Location**.

trans-unit.source: Set an entry point into your app to call when the event is triggered.
trans-unit.target: Set an entry point into your app to call when the event is triggered.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Register the background task
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Register the background task

trans-unit.source: The code in this step registers the geofencing background task.
trans-unit.target: The code in this step registers the geofencing background task.

trans-unit.source: Remember that when the geofence was created, we checked for location permissions.
trans-unit.target: Remember that when the geofence was created, we checked for location permissions.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Set up a geofence](#setup).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Set up a geofence](#setup).

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Handling the background notification
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Handling the background notification

trans-unit.source: The action that you take to notify the user depends on what your app does, but you can display a toast notification, play an audio sound, or update a live tile.
trans-unit.target: The action that you take to notify the user depends on what your app does, but you can display a toast notification, play an audio sound, or update a live tile.

trans-unit.source: The code in this step handles the notification.
trans-unit.target: The code in this step handles the notification.

trans-unit.source: Change the privacy settings
trans-unit.target: Change the privacy settings

trans-unit.source: If the location privacy settings don't allow your app to access the user's location, we recommend that you provide a convenient link to the **location privacy settings** in the **Settings** app.
trans-unit.target: If the location privacy settings don't allow your app to access the user's location, we recommend that you provide a convenient link to the **location privacy settings** in the **Settings** app.

trans-unit.source: In this example, a Hyperlink control is used navigate to the `ms-settings:privacy-location` URI.
trans-unit.target: In this example, a Hyperlink control is used navigate to the `ms-settings:privacy-location` URI.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, your app can call the [**LaunchUriAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701476) method to launch the **Settings** app from code.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, your app can call the [**LaunchUriAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701476) method to launch the **Settings** app from code.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Launch the Windows Settings app](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt228342).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Launch the Windows Settings app](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt228342).

trans-unit.source: Test and debug your app
trans-unit.target: Test and debug your app

trans-unit.source: Testing and debugging geofencing apps can be a challenge because they depend on a device's location.
trans-unit.target: Testing and debugging geofencing apps can be a challenge because they depend on a device's location.

trans-unit.source: Here, we outline several methods for testing both foreground and background geofences.
trans-unit.target: Here, we outline several methods for testing both foreground and background geofences.

trans-unit.source: To debug a geofencing app
trans-unit.target: To debug a geofencing app

trans-unit.source: Physically move the device to new locations.
trans-unit.target: Physically move the device to new locations.

trans-unit.source: Test entering a geofence by creating a geofence region that includes your current physical location, so you're already inside the geofence and the "geofence entered" event is triggered immediately.
trans-unit.target: Test entering a geofence by creating a geofence region that includes your current physical location, so you're already inside the geofence and the "geofence entered" event is triggered immediately.

trans-unit.source: Use the Microsoft Visual Studio emulator to simulate locations for the device.
trans-unit.target: Use the Microsoft Visual Studio emulator to simulate locations for the device.

trans-unit.source: Test and debug a geofencing app that is running in the foreground
trans-unit.target: Test and debug a geofencing app that is running in the foreground

trans-unit.source: To test your geofencing app that is running the foreground
trans-unit.target: To test your geofencing app that is running the foreground

trans-unit.source: Build your app in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Build your app in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Launch your app in the Visual Studio emulator.
trans-unit.target: Launch your app in the Visual Studio emulator.

trans-unit.source: Use these tools to simulate various locations inside and outside of your geofence region.
trans-unit.target: Use these tools to simulate various locations inside and outside of your geofence region.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to wait long enough past the time specified by the [**DwellTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263703) property to trigger the event.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to wait long enough past the time specified by the [**DwellTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263703) property to trigger the event.

trans-unit.source: Note that you must accept the prompt to enable location permissions for the app.
trans-unit.target: Note that you must accept the prompt to enable location permissions for the app.

trans-unit.source: For more info about simulating locations, see [Set the simulated geolocation of the device](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=325245).
trans-unit.target: For more info about simulating locations, see [Set the simulated geolocation of the device](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=325245).

trans-unit.source: You can also use the emulator to estimate the size of fences and dwell times approximately needed to be detected at different speeds.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the emulator to estimate the size of fences and dwell times approximately needed to be detected at different speeds.

trans-unit.source: Test and debug a geofencing app that is running in the background
trans-unit.target: Test and debug a geofencing app that is running in the background

trans-unit.source: To test your geofencing app that is running the background
trans-unit.target: To test your geofencing app that is running the background

trans-unit.source: Build your app in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Build your app in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Note that your app should set the **Location** background task type.
trans-unit.target: Note that your app should set the **Location** background task type.

trans-unit.source: Deploy the app locally first.
trans-unit.target: Deploy the app locally first.

trans-unit.source: Close your app that is running locally.
trans-unit.target: Close your app that is running locally.

trans-unit.source: Launch your app in the Visual Studio emulator.
trans-unit.target: Launch your app in the Visual Studio emulator.

trans-unit.source: Note that background geofencing simulation is supported on only one app at a time within the emulator.
trans-unit.target: Note that background geofencing simulation is supported on only one app at a time within the emulator.

trans-unit.source: Do not launch multiple geofencing apps within the emulator.
trans-unit.target: Do not launch multiple geofencing apps within the emulator.

trans-unit.source: From the emulator, simulate various locations inside and outside of your geofence region.
trans-unit.target: From the emulator, simulate various locations inside and outside of your geofence region.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to wait long enough past the [**DwellTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263703) to trigger the event.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to wait long enough past the [**DwellTime**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263703) to trigger the event.

trans-unit.source: Note that you must accept the prompt to enable location permissions for the app.
trans-unit.target: Note that you must accept the prompt to enable location permissions for the app.

trans-unit.source: Use Visual Studio to trigger the location background task.
trans-unit.target: Use Visual Studio to trigger the location background task.

trans-unit.source: For more info about triggering background tasks in Visual Studio, see [How to trigger background tasks](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=325378).
trans-unit.target: For more info about triggering background tasks in Visual Studio, see [How to trigger background tasks](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=325378).

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot your app
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot your app

trans-unit.source: Before your app can access location, **Location** must be enabled on the device.
trans-unit.target: Before your app can access location, **Location** must be enabled on the device.

trans-unit.source: In the **Settings** app, check that the following **location privacy settings** are turned on:
trans-unit.target: In the **Settings** app, check that the following **location privacy settings** are turned on:

trans-unit.source: **Location for this device...** is turned **on** (not applicable in Windows 10 Mobile)
trans-unit.target: **Location for this device...** is turned **on** (not applicable in Windows 10 Mobile)

trans-unit.source: The location services setting, **Location**, is turned **on**
trans-unit.target: The location services setting, **Location**, is turned **on**

trans-unit.source: Under **Choose apps that can use your location**, your app is set to **on**
trans-unit.target: Under **Choose apps that can use your location**, your app is set to **on**

trans-unit.source: Related topics
trans-unit.target: Related topics

trans-unit.target: UWP geolocation sample

trans-unit.target: Design guidelines for geofencing
